column1: Little Goat Diner////Not your typical diner
column2: though they do have the diner staples and seem to do them well. I arrived nice and early
column3: around 7:30am on a Sunday. The place wasn't full but there were already a few groups there
column4: and within an hour or so it was pretty busy. Every other order I saw come out was for the corned beef hash
column5: which looked really good -- corned beef hash is one of my usual favorite dishes
column6: but after looking over the menu I had to try the "breakfast spaghetti 'n clams 'n crab." There was spaghetti and egg
column7: in a white clam broth with bits of crab and guanciale and bok choy mixed in for a very tasty--if not very breakfast-y
